meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by the presence of a virus in the bloodstream.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient as viremic after finding the virus in their blood.
meanings.sent2: The viremic individual had to undergo special treatment to combat the virus in their bloodstream.
meanings.sent3: The vampire bat joked that it must be viremic after feasting on so much blood.
meanings.sent4: The city was like a viremic organism, with the virus of crime spreading through its veins.
meanings.sent5: The image of the virus swimming in the bloodstream made the concept of viremic clear.

meanings.definition: Having a high level of virus particles in the blood.
meanings.sent1: The viremic patient required immediate medical attention due to the high virus levels in their blood.
meanings.sent2: The doctor was concerned about the viremic individual's health because of the elevated virus particles in their bloodstream.
meanings.sent3: The pet cat playfully claimed to be viremic after accidentally scratching its owner.
meanings.sent4: The polluted river was viremic with contaminants, just like the blood of an infected person.
meanings.sent5: The red color of the viremic liquid under the microscope highlighted the abundance of virus particles.
